div.head: C. C. GENT. IN COMMENDATION OF THIS WORKE.

lg.l: When Alexander came before the graue
Of Peleus sonne, he cryed, O happie knight,
VVhose fortune was, so braue a trumpe to haue,
To blazon forth the glorie of thy might.
So might this Alexander cry aright,
Had he an equall trumpet to his name,
Both th'one and th'other soone outmatch he might,
And all that went afore excell in fame.
But cease ô Scanderbeg, with further blame
To blot thy fortune fayling, of thy worth:
Lo here a trumpe that doth thy acts proclame,
And all thy prowes worthely set forth.
And ye that heare th'atchieuements of his dayes,
Admire his value, and his glorie praise.
